citations.narrative:
An approximately 1.5 year old male Dalmation (microchip ID 991003002177467) was tethered in its kennel. Tethering a
dog for an extended period of time can be uncomfortable and stressful for that dog. In addition, it can result in injury to the
dog. Tethering of dogs for use as a primary enclosure must be discontinued. Correct starting on 7/23/24.

An approximately 1.5 year old male Dalmation (microchip #991003002177467) was tethered in its kennel. The tethering
prevented the dog from reaching the watering nipple. Not having water continuously available may negatively affect the
health and well being of the dog. The dog must be provided potable water on a continual basis. Correct starting on
7/23/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
Bryan Voetberg, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Leann Sargeant, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.6(c)(4) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
An approximately 1.5 year old male Dalmation (microchip ID 991003002177467) was tethered in its kennel. Tethering a 
dog for an extended period of time can be uncomfortable and stressful for that dog. In addition, it can result in injury to the 
dog. Tethering of dogs for use as a primary enclosure must be discontinued. Correct starting on 7/23/24. 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
An approximately 1.5 year old male Dalmation (microchip #991003002177467) was tethered in its kennel. The tethering 
prevented the dog from reaching the watering nipple. Not having water continuously available may negatively affect the 
health and well being of the dog. The dog must be provided potable water on a continual basis. Correct starting on 
7/23/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Bryan Voetberg, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER 
Leann Sargeant, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
